patterns.name: Infrastructure Play Timing
patterns.description: Companies building infrastructure layers (identity, data, integration) tend to emerge in waves following platform shifts
patterns.strategic_implication: Infrastructure opportunities follow application-layer maturation by 2-4 years
patterns.memola_doctrine_link: Structure before execution — infrastructure creates conditions for execution

patterns.name: AI-Native Platform Evolution
patterns.description: Companies founded 2020+ increasingly position AI as core differentiator rather than feature
patterns.strategic_implication: AI as infrastructure vs AI as feature creates different competitive dynamics
patterns.memola_doctrine_link: Reality before narrative — AI must solve real problems, not add marketing claims

patterns.name: Vertical Platform Dominance
patterns.description: Majority of portfolio companies (60%+) follow vertical platform archetype — deep niche focus
patterns.strategic_implication: Vertical depth creates defensibility before horizontal expansion
patterns.memola_doctrine_link: Compounding before scale — depth enables leverage

patterns.name: Data Moat Formation
patterns.description: Companies with strongest platform potential accumulate proprietary data that improves with usage
patterns.strategic_implication: Data moat quality determines long-term defensibility more than initial product
patterns.memola_doctrine_link: Assets before activity — data is the durable asset

patterns.name: Enterprise vs Consumer Bifurcation
patterns.description: Clear separation between B2B enterprise plays and consumer-facing platforms with different success patterns
patterns.strategic_implication: Hybrid B2B2C models show higher complexity but greater optionality
patterns.memola_doctrine_link: Systems before tactics — market positioning is structural

patterns.name: Regulatory Moat Strategy
patterns.description: Subset of companies use regulatory complexity as moat rather than barrier
patterns.memola_doctrine_link: Reality before narrative — regulations are constraints to work within

patterns.name: EdTech Platform Convergence
patterns.description: Education technology companies converging on skills measurement and AI-assisted learning
patterns.strategic_implication: Skills verification becoming key value layer in education stack
patterns.memola_doctrine_link: Compounding before scale — verified skills accumulate credential value

patterns.name: Gig Economy Infrastructure Gap
patterns.description: Worker-side infrastructure for gig economy remains underdeveloped vs platform side
patterns.strategic_implication: Opportunity for financial services and workflow tools for gig workers
patterns.memola_doctrine_link: Structure before execution — worker infrastructure needs designing

patterns.name: Defense Tech Emergence 2025
patterns.description: New wave of defense technology companies emerging with AI-native approaches
patterns.strategic_implication: Defense sector modernization creating infrastructure opportunities
patterns.memola_doctrine_link: Institution modernization archetype — high legitimacy, low digital presence

patterns.name: Integration Layer Value
patterns.description: Unified API and integration platforms capturing significant enterprise value
patterns.strategic_implication: Integration complexity as durable problem creates platform opportunities
patterns.memola_doctrine_link: Platform building logic — fragmented information creates aggregation leverage

patterns.name: Creator Economy Maturation
patterns.description: Creator platforms evolving from monetization to full business infrastructure
patterns.strategic_implication: Creator tools becoming creator operating systems
patterns.memola_doctrine_link: Artisanal to scalable brand — systematize without losing identity

patterns.name: Public Exit Rarity
patterns.description: Only 2 of 28 companies reached public status; majority remain private growth stage
patterns.strategic_implication: Long private phases becoming norm; liquidity patience required
patterns.memola_doctrine_link: Compounding before scale — value must accumulate before exit

patterns.name: Vintage Cohort Risk
patterns.description: Companies founded in same year share funding environment, technology context, and macro exposures creating correlated risk
patterns.strategic_implication: Portfolio diversification should consider founding year distribution; 2021-2022 cohort faces simultaneous pressure
patterns.memola_doctrine_link: Reality before narrative — external environment shapes company trajectories

patterns.name: Value Mechanism Stacking
patterns.description: Companies with multiple value mechanisms (aggregation, efficiency, enablement, intelligence, access, infrastructure, credential) show higher platform potential and defensibility
patterns.strategic_implication: Single value mechanism = replicable; multiple mechanisms = compound moat
patterns.memola_doctrine_link: Assets before activity — multiple value mechanisms create durable assets

patterns.name: AI Depth Hierarchy
patterns.description: Three levels of AI commitment create different risk/reward profiles: AI-Native (couldn't exist without AI), AI-Enhanced (AI significantly improves offering), AI-Augmented (AI adds features)
patterns.strategic_implication: AI-native companies face compute/talent competition but have stronger technical moats
patterns.memola_doctrine_link: Structure before execution — AI depth determines competitive structure

patterns.name: Trust Moat Companies
patterns.description: Companies whose primary moat is accumulated trust (regulatory, institutional, credential) move slowly but create high barriers; trust is slow to build, easy to lose, hard to transfer
patterns.strategic_implication: Trust-moat companies fit MEMOLA model (long-term, compounding) but face reputation/defection risks
patterns.memola_doctrine_link: Compounding before scale — trust is the ultimate compound asset

patterns.name: Information Advantage Portfolio
patterns.description: Portfolio's center of gravity is information advantage creation — companies win by knowing more than competitors or customers
patterns.strategic_implication: Data protection regulations are portfolio-level risk; AI capability determines value extraction; information moats are true moats
patterns.memola_doctrine_link: Assets before activity — information is the primary asset class

patterns.name: Strategic Collision Probability
patterns.description: Companies in adjacent spaces face probability of strategic collision as they expand; enterprise AI companies (Automation Anywhere, Uniphore, Arkestro) likely to collide
patterns.strategic_implication: Monitor for strategy convergence triggers (funding, market maturity, tech convergence); predict collision scenarios
patterns.memola_doctrine_link: Reality before narrative — competitive dynamics are structural, not aspirational
